title: RFA UK Receives £3.5M for SaxaVord Development
summary:
Rocket Factory Ltd, the UK-based subsidiary of the German launch startup Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA), has received £3.5 million in funding from the UK Space Agency and the European Space Agency to support its plans to launch from SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland. The funding was awarded as part of the ESA Boost! programme, which aims […]
The post RFA UK Receives £3.5M for SaxaVord Development appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: AFRL, Space Force to collaborate with Indian startups on space technologies
summary: The Air Force Research Laboratory announced new Cooperative Research and Development Agreements, or CRADAs, between the U.S. Space Force and two Indian startups.

title: NASA Is Locating Ice on Mars With This New Map
summary: The map could help the agency decide where the first astronauts to the Red Planet should land. The more available water, the less missions will need to bring.

title: Investing in Space: How the Pentagon sizes up China’s military strength in space
summary: I consider one of my roles as a reporter to be, “I read this so you don’t have to,” and this instance features the Pentagon’s annual report to Congress on China’s military and security developments. Coming in at a whopping 212 pages, the document represents the latest in-depth, albeit unclassified, view of China’s military ambitions.

title: Tesat optical terminals selected for Lockheed Martin satellites pass ground tests
summary: Tesat-Spacecom’s laser communications terminals passed key ground tests required to be deployed on Space Development Agency satellites, the company announced Oct. 26.
